transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi Zhi, this is Arjun calling from MongoDB. Is now an okay time to talk for a couple minutes?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Um, sure, I have a few minutes. What’s this about?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Thanks, I’ll be brief. I noticed Acme Corp. has been scaling a lot on DynamoDB, and I wanted to see if you’re open to discussing how MongoDB Atlas could help with your current database challenges?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, we’ve run into some... bumps as we’ve scaled up. Our workloads have gotten a bit more unpredictable lately.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That’s actually super common. When workloads shift, Dynamo’s pricing and data modeling can get tricky. Would you mind sharing what’s been toughest for your team?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Sure. Mainly, cost predictability, and, honestly, data modeling has become painful. Our data’s getting more complex, and we’re having to jump through hoops with Dynamo.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That makes sense. MongoDB Atlas gives you a flexible schema, so you can model and evolve your data without major overhauls. And costs are more predictable since you pay for your cluster’s resources, not per operation.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: But wouldn’t migration be a big lift? We’ve got a lot built on Dynamo, and honestly, the risk of downtime or lost data isn’t something I can easily justify.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely, migration’s always a concern. We actually have tooling—like our Atlas Live Migration Service—and partners who’ve helped fintechs just like Acme move with near-zero downtime. We can help you map out a transition plan before you commit.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: What about compliance? We’re in fintech—security and data residency are top priorities for us.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally understood. Atlas runs on AWS, Azure, or GCP and offers SOC 2, PCI DSS, GDPR, and regional controls. We support encryption at rest and in transit, plus audit logging out of the box.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Okay, that’s good to know. I’m still wary about vendor lock-in, though, if we go down this route. We don’t want to be stuck, you know?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That’s a fair concern. With Atlas, your data’s always your own—no proprietary binary formats. And MongoDB is open source, so you can run it anywhere if you need to.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Okay, so—how would this get started? What’s next if we want to explore more?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Great question. I’d suggest a quick discovery call with one of our solution architects next week. We’ll review your current workloads and map out what a pilot could look like—no commitment needed.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: All right, yeah, let’s set something up. Can you send me some times by email?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely. I’ll follow up in the next hour. Thanks for your time, Zhi—you’ve been really helpful.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Thanks, Arjun. Look forward to your email.
